headline: General Mills Guidance Cut Tests Brand Strength And Valuation Story
summary: General Mills (NYSE:GIS) has cut its full year sales and profit outlook as consumers show higher price sensitivity. The company reports more shoppers choosing value focused and private label brands across key categories. Management is responding by accelerating work on protein based products to better match changing eating habits. General Mills, the owner of brands across cereal, snacks and meal solutions, is feeling the impact of tighter household budgets as shoppers trade toward lower...
